item.title: Cody add a quote by James Thurber
item.description: "Nowadays most men lead lives of noisy desperation. " -- James Thurber

item.title: Cody add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Cody add a quote by Peter De Vries
item.description: "He resented such questions as people do who have thought a great deal about them. The superficial and slipshod have ready answers, but those looking this complex life straight in the eye acquire a wealth of perception so composed of delicately balanced contradictions that they dread, or resent, the call to couch any part of it in a bland generalization. The vanity (if not outrage) of trying to cage this dance of atoms in a single definition may give the weariness of age with the cry of youth for answers the appearance of boredom." -- Peter De Vries

item.title: Cody add a quote by Edward Dahlberg
item.description: "Let the bard from Smyrna catalogue Harma, the ledges and caves of Thaca, the milk-fed damsels of Achaia, pigeon-flocked Thisbe or the woods of Onchestus, I sing of Oak, Walnut, Chesnut, Maple and Elm Streets." -- Edward Dahlberg

item.title: Cody add a quote by Harvey Pekar
item.description: "Ordinary life is pretty complex stuff." -- Harvey Pekar
